channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Baby died in 'unsurvivable' fire in bedroom
item.description: A Christchurch community is reeling after a tragic house fire killed two young children.

item.title: Police investigate potential hack of data it sent to research company
item.description: Police are investigating a potential hack of their own information, which had been sent to a research company.

item.title: Freedom camping issues put in the past as numbers grow
item.description: The Queenstown Lakes District Council is preparing for an economic boost from campervans in the area this summer.

item.title: Hipkins urges use of contact tracer app - 'Step up your efforts'
item.description: The Health Minister has asked New Zealanders to step up and use the contact tracer app, saying he believes there is a degree of complacency, even as the risk grows every day.

item.title: Steven Wallace case: Lawyer tells court contradictory evidence never addressed
item.description: A court has been told there were contradictory accounts from officers about what happened the night a man was shot dead by police in Waitara.

item.title: Two new cases of Covid-19 in NZ today
item.description: There are two new cases of Covid-19 in New Zealand's managed isolation facilities today, Dr Ashley Bloomfield has confirmed.

item.title: Eight-year-old girl reported missing in Hamilton found safe and well
item.description: An 8-year-old Hamilton girl who had been reported missing earlier today has been found.

item.title: New school bus tendering 'a phenomenal cock-up', Bus and Coach Association boss says
item.description: Bus companies are worried a new Ministry of Education plan for tendering school bus routes will annihilate medium-sized firms, particularly in the regions.

item.title: Failures at Affco meat plant led to worker suffering severe burns - WorkSafe
item.description: The worker suffered burns to 75 percent of his body when he opened a furnace door and a build-up of coal combusted.

item.title: Cape Kidnappers track to reopen this year
item.description: A risky Hawke's Bay walkway on Cape Kidnappers will reopen at the end of the year, even though the walk is unpredictable and potentially fatal.

item.title: Plans to reduce waste released by government
item.description: The levy rate for landfills that take household waste will increase over four years from $10 a tonne to $60, and council rubbish bags will cost about 25 cents more.

item.title: Police shooting of man at Hastings school justified - IPCA
item.description: An officer who shot and wounded a man in the grounds of a Hastings school has been cleared by the Independent Police Conduct Authority.

item.title: District court awaits special group's recommendations to improve efficiency
item.description: Significant changes are afoot in the country's largest and busiest court as a special group finalises its recommendations to make the justice system more efficient.

item.title: Anxious wait for New Zealand deportees as Australian guards isolate due to Covid-19 risk
item.description: Twenty-one coronavirus cases are linked to an outbreak at a Sydney pub, where some guards from the Villawood detention centre were attending a party.

item.title: Two dead in Christchurch house fire
item.description: Several people escaped the fire overnight, but it is believed that two young children died inside.

item.title: GPs welcome new Covid-19 testing guidelines: 'You can't be complacent'
item.description: Doctors are being told to test older, MÄori and Pasifika patients with any respiratory illnesses, and people can now request a throat swab in place of a nasal swab.

item.title: Police carried out unlawful searches after Christchurch mosque attacks
item.description: Three police searches - carried out shortly after the Christchurch mosque attacks - were unlawful, the Independent Police Conduct Authority has found.

item.title: Unreported $800,000 catch sees prominent Chathams fisherman sentenced
item.description: A prominent Chatham Islands fisherman has been sentenced to home detention and community service for failing to declare over 11 tonnes of shellfish.
